intro: Fritillaria duilongdeqingensis, commonly known as the Duilongdeqing fritillary, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its bulbous structure is typical of the Fritillaria genus, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for certain insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
